question: 澄ます
sourceMnemonic:
<ja>澄む</ja> is "to become clear" - this is when you make something clear, because you <reading>mus</reading>t (<ja>ます</ja>) make it clear. You have to. That's why this is or <vocabulary>to make something clear</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to clear something</vocabulary>.

This can also mean <vocabulary>to strain</vocabulary> when used together with <ja>耳</ja>, as in <ja>耳を澄ます</ja>, "to strain one's ears".
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the kanji, so if you know that, that'll make this answer clear too.
